metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
BILL OF SALE-Printed and Sold by A.E. MILLER.

The State of South-Carolina.
KNOW ALL MEN, by these Presents,
THAT I John Fraser Merchant
Charleston

for and in consideration of the sum of Five hundred Dollars

to me in hand paid, at and before the sealing and delivery of these
Presents,
by Miss Maria Drayton

[the receipt whereof I do- hereby acknowledge] have bargained and
sold, and by these Presents, do bargain, sell and deliver, the said Miss Maria
Drayton a Negroe Man, Hercules for whom
I paid Governor Miller Six hundred and twenty
five Dollars

TO HAVE AND TO HOLD the said
Negroe Hercules
unto the said
Miss Maria Drayton her

executors, administrators, and assigns, to her and her only proper use and
behoof, forever. AND I the said
John Fraser- my Executors Administrators
and assign do [illegible] and deferred by these presents
said Negroe Sold as above. Named Hercules-

In witness whereof, I have hereunto set my Hand and Seal
Dated at Charleston- on the Fifteenth day
of Augt [August] in the year of our Lord one thousand eight
hundred and Thirty five and in the sixteenth
year of the Independence of the United States of America.

SIGNED, SEALED AND DELIVERED,
IN THE PRESENCE OF

LA Shecut

[illegible] Seal
